original_content:
VERSE FOR 5-2-2019:

_Let your good deeds shine out for all to see so that_

_everyone will praise your heavenly Father. _(Mt. 5/16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY

If we live for Christ, we will glow like lights, showing others

what Christ is like. We hide our light by (1) being quiet when

we should speak. (2) going along with the crowd. (3) denying

the light. (4) letting sin dim our light. (5) not explain our light

to others. (6) Or, Ignoring the needs of others. BE A BEACON OF

TRUTH -- DON'T SHUT YOUR LIGHT OFF FROM THE REST OF THE WORLD.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: If we live for Christ, we will glow like lights, showing others what Christ is like. We hide our light by (1) being quiet when we should speak. (2) going along with the crowd. (3) denying the light. (4) letting sin dim our light. (5) not explain our light to others. (6) Or, Ignoring the needs of others. BE A BEACON OF TRUTH -- DON'T SHUT YOUR LIGHT OFF FROM THE REST OF THE WORLD.
original_verse_text: In the same way, let your good deeds shine out for all to see, so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the light of Your truth that shines in our hearts. Help us to walk as children of light, bearing the fruit of goodness, righteousness, and truth. May our lives be a beacon that reflects the radiance of Christ, drawing others to the saving knowledge of Your Son. Give us the courage to speak up, stand firm, and meet the needs of those around us, that Your name may be glorified. Amen.
reflection: If we live for Christ, we will glow like lights, showing others what Christ is like. We hide our light by (1) being quiet when we should speak, (2) going along with the crowd, (3) denying the light, (4) letting sin dim our light, (5) not explaining our light to others, or (6) ignoring the needs of others. Be a beacon of truth -- don't shut your light off from the rest of the world.
subject: Be Sure to Shine
verse_text: In the same way, let your good deeds shine out for all to see, so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father.

original_content:
VERSE FOR %/3/2019:

_We can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort_

_we ourselves receive from God. _(2 Cor. 1:4) READ

2 Cor. 1:1-7

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

All around us are people in need, and sometimes we have to set aside

our own feelings and agendas to help them. One way we can do that

is to remember how God has comforted us in our trials and troubles

"so we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves

have received from God. How easy it is to be engrossed in our own

concerns and forget that someone right next to us might need a
prayer,

a word of comfort, a hug, or a gift of mercy in Jesus's name.

COMFORT RECEIVED SHOULD BE COMFORT GIVEN.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: All around us are people in need, and sometimes we have to set aside our own feelings and agendas to help them. One way we can do that is to remember how God has comforted us in our trials and troubles "so we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves have received from God. How easy it is to be engrossed in our own concerns and forget that someone right next to us might need a prayer, a word of comfort, a hug, or a gift of mercy in Jesus's name. COMFORT RECEIVED SHOULD BE COMFORT GIVEN.
original_verse_text: We can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the comfort and strength You have graciously provided us in our times of trial and tribulation. Just as You have embraced us with Your loving kindness, we pray that You would open our eyes to see the needs of those around us. May we be vessels of Your comfort, extending the same compassion and care that we have received from You to those who are hurting and in need. Guide us, Lord, to be attentive to the prompting of Your Spirit, that we may offer the hope and encouragement found in Your Word. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: All around us are people in need, and sometimes we have to set aside our own feelings and agendas to help them. One way we can do that is to remember how God has comforted us in our trials and troubles “so we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves have received from God.” How easy it is to be engrossed in our own concerns and forget that someone right next to us might need a prayer, a word of comfort, a hug, or a gift of mercy in Jesus's name. COMFORT RECEIVED SHOULD BE COMFORT GIVEN.
subject: Just What We Need
verse_text: We can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/4/2019:

_He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our_

_God and repair its ruins._ (Ezra 9:9) READ Lam. 5:8-22

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Troubles of our own making and conflicts we can't avoid may

leave us devastated. But we have a Father who understands.

Gently patiently, He clears away the rubble, repurposes it, and

builds something better. It takes time but we can always trust

Him. GOD WILL ONE DAY RESTORE ALL THE BEAUTY LOST BEFORE.

_PASTOR AL_

I HAVE TO MAKE A TRIP TO THE CITIES THIS WEEKEND AND I WON'T BE BACK

UNTIL LATE MONDAY (HOPEFULLY)
original_reflection_text: Troubles of our own making and conflicts we can't avoid may leave us devastated. But we have a Father who understands. Gently patiently, He clears away the rubble, repurposed it, and builds something better. It takes time but we can always trust Him. GOD WILL ONE DAY RESTORE ALL THE BEAUTY LOST BEFORE.
original_verse_text: He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in humble recognition of the troubles we have brought upon ourselves and the conflicts that overwhelm us. Yet, we take comfort in the knowledge that You are a patient and loving God, who can take the rubble of our lives and repurpose it for something better. Though the process may be slow, we trust in Your steadfast promise to one day restore all the beauty that has been lost. Give us the strength to persevere, Lord, and the faith to believe in Your perfect plan. Amen.
reflection: Troubles of our own making and conflicts we can't avoid may leave us devastated. But we have a Father who understands. Gently, patiently, He clears away the rubble, repurposes it, and builds something better. It takes time, but we can always trust Him. God will one day restore all the beauty lost before.
subject: Rebuilding Projects
verse_text: He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 8:

_Though you have not seen Him, you love Him. _(I Pet. 1:8)

READ -- I Peter 1:1-9

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Peter, as a personal friend of Jesus, was writing to people who

had only heard about the One who had given them reason for

so much hope in the middle of their troubles. Yet, as a part of

the larger community of believers, they loved Him. They knew

that at the price of His own life, He had brought them into the

everlasting family of God. OUR LOVE FOR CHRIST IS ONLY AS REAL

AS OUR LOVE FOR OUR NEIGHBOR.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Peter, as a personal friend of Jesus, was writing to people who had only heard about the One who had given them reason for so much hope in the middle of their troubles. Yet, as a part of the larger community of believers, they loved Him. They knew that at the price of His own life, He had brought them into the everlasting family of God. OUR LOVE FOR CHRIST IS ONLY AS REAL AS OUR LOVE FOR OUR NEIGHBOR.
original_verse_text: Though you have not seen Him, you love Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the hope and joy that comes from knowing Your Son, Jesus Christ, even though we have not seen Him. May our love for You be reflected in our love and care for one another, as we seek to live out the new life You have given us through the sacrifice of Your beloved Son. Help us to remain steadfast in our faith, even in the midst of trials, trusting in the eternal inheritance that awaits us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Peter, as a personal friend of Jesus, was writing to people who had only heard about the One who had given them reason for so much hope in the middle of their troubles. Yet, as a part of the larger community of believers, they loved Him. They knew that at the price of His own life, He had brought them into the everlasting family of God. Our love for Christ is only as real as our love for our neighbor.
subject: Unseen, yet Loved
verse_text: Though you have not seen Him, you love Him.

original_content:
DEVO. FOR MAY 9:

_Encourage one another daily. _( Heb. 3:13)

READ: I Thess. 4:1-12

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Through His death and resurrection, Jesus has connected us

to one another. So we have the responsibility and privilege

with God's enablement to encourage fellow believers to finish

the climb of trusting and obeying Him. SO LET US REMEMBER,

TO ENCOURAGE ONE ANOTHER AND BUILD ONE ANOTHER UP.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Through His death and resurrection, Jesus has connected us to one another. So we have the responsibility and privilege with God's enablement to encourage fellow believers to finish the climb of trusting and obeying Him. SO LET US REMEMBER, TO ENCOURAGE ONE ANOTHER AND BUILD ONE ANOTHER UP.
original_verse_text: Encourage one another daily.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the profound connection we share through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus. Grant us the wisdom and courage to encourage one another daily, building each other up in our faith, as we journey together towards the prize of eternal life. May our lives be a testament to Your love, as we spur one another on to greater obedience and trust in You. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Through His death and resurrection, Jesus has connected us to one another. So we have the responsibility and privilege, with God's enablement, to encourage fellow believers to finish the climb of trusting and obeying Him. So let us remember to encourage one another and build one another up.
subject: Keep Climbing!
verse_text: Encourage one another daily.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 10_Take . The sword of the Spirit, which is the Word
of God._(Eph.6:17) READ (Nehemiah 4:7-18)THOUGHT FOR TODAYIf we think
that working for God doesn't matter, we should turn to the promise
that what we do for Jesus will last for eternity( I Cor. 3:11-15). If
we fear we have sinned too greatly for Godto use us, we must remember
we've been forgiven by the powerof Jesus's blood (Mat. 26:28). And if
we're worried we might fail if we try to serve God, we should remember
that Jesus said we willbear fruit as we abide in Him (Jn. 15:5).
GOD'S WORD IS OUR DIVINE DEFENSE._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: If we think that working for God doesn't matter, we should turn to the promise that what we do for Jesus will last for eternity( I Corinthians 3:11-15). If we fear we have sinned too greatly for Godto use us, we must remember we've been forgiven by the powerof Jesus's blood (Matthew 26:28). And if we're worried we might fail if we try to serve God, we should remember that Jesus said we willbear fruit as we abide in Him (John 15:5). GOD'S WORD IS OUR DIVINE DEFENSE.
original_verse_text: Take the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and strength as we strive to serve You faithfully. Help us to remember that our work for Your kingdom has eternal significance, and that we have been forgiven and cleansed by the power of Jesus's blood. Give us the courage to step out in faith, knowing that as we abide in You, we will bear the fruit of Your Spirit. May Your Word be our divine defense, shielding us from the attacks of the enemy. We trust in Your sovereign plan and purpose for our lives. Amen.
reflection: If we think that working for God doesn't matter, we should turn to the promise that what we do for Jesus will last for eternity (I Corinthians 3:11-15). If we fear we have sinned too greatly for God to use us, we must remember we've been forgiven by the power of Jesus's blood (Matthew 26:28). And if we're worried we might fail if we try to serve God, we should remember that Jesus said we will bear fruit as we abide in Him (John 15:5). God's Word is our divine defense.
subject: Our Divine Defense
verse_text: Take the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 11:_His compassions never fail. They are new every
morning;__great is your faithfulness._ (Lam. 3:22-23) READ Ps.
86:5-15THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Some of us have made wrong choices in our
lives, but our pastwords and deeds need not define our future in God's
eyes. Thereis always a fresh start. When we ask for His forgiveness,
WE TAKEa first step toward restoring our relationship with Him and
withothers. "If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will
forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness." (I Jn.
1:9) EACH NEW DAY GIVES US NEW REASONS TO PRAISE THE LORD._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Some of us have made wrong choices in our lives, but our passwords and deeds need not define our future in God's eyes. Thereis always a fresh start. When we ask for His forgiveness, WE TAKEa first step toward restoring our relationship with Him and with others. "If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness." (I John 1:9) EACH NEW DAY GIVES US NEW REASONS TO PRAISE THE LORD.
original_verse_text: His compassion's never fail. They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the knowledge that our choices have not always been righteous. Yet, we are grateful for Your steadfast love and abundant mercy, which are new every morning. Lord, we confess our sins and ask for Your forgiveness, trusting that You are faithful to cleanse us and restore our relationship with You. May each new day be a fresh start, filled with reasons to praise Your name. Amen.
reflection: Some of us have made wrong choices in our lives, but our passwords and deeds need not define our future in God's eyes. There is always a fresh start. When we ask for His forgiveness, we take a first step toward restoring our relationship with Him and with others. “If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.” (1 John 1:9) Each new day gives us new reasons to praise the Lord.
subject: Start Fresh
verse_text: His compassion's never fail. They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 12:_For God did not send His Son __into the word to
condemn the__world but to save the world through Him._ (John 3:17)
READ(Jn. 3:9-21)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:The more SOME PEOPLE read the Bible,
the more they judge others who aren't doing what it says. Instead let
us take thisapproach, let us show them God's love and let the Holy
Spiritreshape them. INSTEAD OF BEING AGENTS OF CONDEMNATION, WE ARE TO
BE AMBASSADORS OF GOD'S LOVE AND MERCY. _ PASTOR AL___
original_reflection_text: The more SOME PEOPLE read the Bible, the more they judge others who aren't doing what it says. Instead let us take thisapproach, let us show them God's love and let the Holy Spiritreshape them. INSTEAD OF BEING AGENTS OF CONDEMNATION, WE ARE TO BE AMBASSADORS OF GOD'S LOVE AND MERCY.
original_verse_text: For God did not send His Son into the word to condemn theworld but to save the world through Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that we are all in need of Your grace and mercy. Help us to be ambassadors of Your love, rather than agents of condemnation. May we follow the example of Your Son, who came not to condemn the world, but to save it. Guide us by the power of Your Holy Spirit, that we may show Your love and compassion to all, and lead others to the transforming power of Your Word. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The more some people read the Bible, the more they judge others who aren't doing what it says. Instead, let us take this approach, let us show them God's love and let the Holy Spirit reshape them. Instead of being agents of condemnation, we are to be ambassadors of God's love and mercy.
subject: God's Agents
verse_text: For God did not send His Son into the word to condemn theworld but to save the world through Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 13:_I will not forget you!_ (Isa. 49:15) READ Isa.
49:13-21THOUGHT FOR TODAY:God compared His love for His people with a
mother's lovefor her child. When we are distressed or disillusioned,
we mayfeel abandoned by society, family, and friends, but God doesnot
abandon us. It is an encouragement that the Lord says, "Ihave engraved
you on the palms of my hands. (vs. 16) to indicatehow much He knows
and protects us. EVEN IF PEOPLE FORSAKE US,GOD WILL NEVER FORSAKE HIS
OWN._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God compared His love for His people with a mother's love for her child. When we are distressed or disillusioned, we may feel abandoned by society, family, and friends, but God does not abandon us. It is an encouragement that the Lord says, "I have engraved you on the palms of my hands. (vs. 16) to indicate how much He knows and protects us. EVEN IF PEOPLE FORSAKE US, GOD WILL NEVER FORSAKE HIS OWN.
original_verse_text: I will not forget you!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your love for us is greater than a mother's love for her child. When we feel abandoned and alone, remind us that You have engraved us on the palms of Your hands, and that You will never forsake us. Even when the world turns its back, we know that You are our constant companion, our ever-present help in times of trouble. Lord, strengthen our faith and fill us with the assurance of Your unwavering love. Amen.
reflection: God compared His love for His people with a mother's love for her child. When we are distressed or disillusioned, we may feel abandoned by society, family, and friends, but God does not abandon us. It is an encouragement that the Lord says, “I have engraved you on the palms of my hands.” (vs. 16) to indicate how much He knows and protects us. Even if people forsake us, God will never forsake His own.
subject: Not Forgotten
verse_text: I will not forget you!

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 14:_Jesus said, "My food, is to do the will of Him who
sent__me, and to finish Hi__s work." _(Jn. 4:34) READ Jn.
4:4-14THOUGHT FOR TODAY:The food which Jesus was speaking of was His
special nourishment. It includes more than Bible study, prayer, and
attending church services. Spiritual nourishment also comes from doing
God's will and helping to bring His work of salvation to completion.
WE ARE NOURISHED NOTONLY BY WHAT WE TAKE IN, BUT ALSO BY WHAT WE GIVE
OUTFOR GOD. _ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The food which Jesus was speaking of was His special nourishment. It includes more than Bible study, prayer, and attending church services. Spiritual nourishment also comes from doing God's will and helping to bring His work of salvation to completion. WE ARE NOURISHED NOTONLY BY WHAT WE TAKE IN, BUT ALSO BY WHAT WE GIVE OUTFOR GOD.
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "My food, is to do the will of Him who sent me, and to finish His work."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the spiritual nourishment that comes from doing Your will and participating in Your work of salvation. May we find our sustenance not only in the intake of Your Word, but also in the outpouring of our lives for Your kingdom purposes. Grant us the strength and wisdom to faithfully fulfill the mission You have set before us, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The food which Jesus was speaking of was His special nourishment. It includes more than Bible study, prayer, and attending church services. Spiritual nourishment also comes from doing God's will and helping to bring His work of salvation to completion. We are nourished not only by what we take in, but also by what we give out for God.
subject: Field of Service
verse_text: Jesus said, “My food, is to do the will of Him who sent me, and to finish His work.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 15:_You know when I sit and when I rise, You perceive my
__thoughts_ _from afar._ (Ps. 139:2) READ Ps. 139:1-18THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:When it comes to our relationship with God we don't need radios,
phones, or emergency beacons. no matter how precarious our
circumstances become, He already knows who and where we are. The
psalmist celebrated this when he wrote, "You have searched me, Lord,
and You know me . You are familiar with all my ways."(Ps. 139:1-3)
OUR NEEDS ARE NEVER HIDDEN FROM GOD, AND WE ARE NEVER SEPARATED FROM
HIS CARE._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When it comes to our relationship with God we don't need radios, phones, or emergency beacons. no matter how precarious our circumstances become, He already knows who and where we are. The psalmist celebrated this when he wrote, "You have searched me, Lord, and You know me. You are familiar with all my ways." (Psalm 139: 1-3) OUR NEEDS ARE NEVER HIDDEN FROM GOD, AND WE ARE NEVER SEPARATED FROM HIS CARE.
original_verse_text: You know when I sit and when I rise, You perceive my thoughts from afar.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your intimate knowledge of us. You have searched our hearts and know our every thought and way. Though we may feel lost or alone, we are never separated from Your loving care. Help us to find comfort in the truth that You are always near, attentive to our needs. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: When it comes to our relationship with God, we don't need radios, phones, or emergency beacons. No matter how precarious our circumstances become, He already knows who and where we are. The psalmist celebrated this when he wrote, “You have searched me, Lord, and You know me. You are familiar with all my ways.” (Psalm 139:1-3) Our needs are never hidden from God, and we are never separated from His care.
subject: Always in His Care
verse_text: You know when I sit and when I rise, You perceive my thoughts from afar.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 16:_The serpent said, "Really? did God really say you
must not eat __any of the fruit of the garden?_ (Gen. 3:1) READ (Gen.
3:1-8)_ _THOUGHT FOR TODAYSatin tempted Eve and succeeded, in getting
her to sin. He even tempted Jesus (Mt. 4:1-11) But Jesus did not sin!
How could Eve have resisted this temptation? By following the same
guide lines we can follow. FIRST: we must realize that being tempted
is not a sin.We have not sinned until we give into the temptation.
THEN, to resist temptation, we must (1) pray for strength to resist
(2) run sometimes literally and (3) say no when confronted what we now
is wrong. JM. 1:12 TELLS OF THE BLESSINGS AND REWARDS FOR THOSE WHO
DON'T GIVE IN WHEN TEMPTED._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Satan tempted Eve and succeeded, in getting her to sin. He even tempted Jesus (Matthew 4: 1-11) But Jesus did not sin! How could Eve have resisted this temptation? By following the same guide lines we can follow. FIRST: we must realize that being tempted is not a sin. We have not sinned until we give into the temptation. THEN, to resist temptation, we must (1) pray for strength to resist (2) run sometimes literally and (3) say no when confronted what we now is wrong. JM. 1:12 TELLS OF THE BLESSINGS AND REWARDS FOR THOSE WHO DON'T GIVE IN WHEN TEMPTED
original_verse_text: The serpent said, "Really? did God really say you must not eat any of the fruit of the garden?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the reality of temptation that has plagued humanity since the days of Eden. Like Eve, we too are vulnerable to the schemes of the evil one, but we are grateful that You have provided us with the means to resist. Help us, Lord, to be vigilant in prayer, swift to flee from sin, and steadfast in our commitment to do what is right. May we find strength in Your Word and the power of Your Spirit to overcome the temptations that seek to draw us away from Your perfect will. We give You all the glory, for You alone are worthy. Amen.
reflection: Satan tempted Eve and succeeded, in getting her to sin. He even tempted Jesus (Matthew 4: 1-11) But Jesus did not sin! How could Eve have resisted this temptation? By following the same guide lines we can follow. FIRST: we must realize that being tempted is not a sin. We have not sinned until we give into the temptation. THEN, to resist temptation, we must (1) pray for strength to resist (2) run sometimes literally and (3) say no when confronted what we now is wrong. JM. 1:12 TELLS OF THE BLESSINGS AND REWARDS FOR THOSE WHO DON'T GIVE IN WHEN TEMPTED
subject: Is He Good?
verse_text: The serpent said, “Really? did God really say you must not eat any of the fruit of the garden?

original_content:
SORRY IF YOU HAVE ALREADY RECEIVED THIS DEVO. THIS COMPUTER IS WANTING
TO DO IT'S OWN THING
VERSE FOR MAY 17:_At the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do
not give up._(Gal. 6:9) READ (Gal. 6:1-10)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Do you
ever get discouraged by an apparent lack of spiritual growth? Do you
frequently lose your temper or enjoy that spicy bit of gossip youjust
can't resist passing on! ! Do you get up to late to pray and read
yourBible, in spite of resolving to set the alarm earlier. Here is a
suggestion,ask a trusted friend about the areas of your life in which
you want to grow spiritually and have that person pray for you and
encourage you to be accountable. Be patient! ! YOU WILL GROW AS YOU
ALLOW THE HOLY SPIRIT TO WORK IN YOU. _ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Do you ever get discouraged by an apparent lack of spiritual growth? Do you frequently lose your temper or enjoy that spicy bit of gossip youjust can't resist passing on! ! Do you get up to late to pray and read yourBible, in spite of resolving to set the alarm earlier. Here is a suggestion, ask a trusted friend about the areas of your life in which you want to grow spiritually and have that person pray for you and encourage you to be accountable. Be patient! ! YOU WILL GROW AS YOU ALLOW THE HOLY SPIRIT TO WORK IN YOU.
original_verse_text: At the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our human weaknesses and the temptations that so easily beset us. We confess our struggles with spiritual growth, our lack of discipline, and our tendency to indulge in sinful desires. Lord, we ask that You would grant us the patience and perseverance to continue in well-doing, trusting that in due season, we will reap the harvest of Your blessings. May we lean on the encouragement of our brothers and sisters in Christ, and may the Holy Spirit empower us to walk faithfully with You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Do you ever get discouraged by an apparent lack of spiritual growth? Do you frequently lose your temper or enjoy that spicy bit of gossip you just can't resist passing on? Do you get up too late to pray and read your Bible, in spite of resolving to set the alarm earlier? Here is a suggestion: ask a trusted friend about the areas of your life in which you want to grow spiritually and have that person pray for you and encourage you to be accountable. Be patient! You will grow as you allow the Holy Spirit to work in you.
subject: Time to Grow
verse_text: At the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 18:_Give us this day our daily bread: _ ( Lk. 11:3) READ
10:38--11:4THOUGHT FOR TODAY:When Martha and Mary invited Jesus to
their house it was spiritualfood that Mary chose when she sat at the
feet of Jesus (Lk. 10:39).Martha on the other hand was concerned about
physical food, Mary was taking time to be near their guests, and
listen to the Lord Jesus.Let us also take time. Let us remember John
6:35 which tells us Hefeeds our hearts with spiritual food. HE IS THE
BREAD THAT SATISFIES. _ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When Martha and Mary invited Jesus to their house it was spiritualfood that Mary chose when she sat at the feet of Jesus (Luke 10: 39). Martha on the other hand was concerned about physical food, Mary was taking time to be near their guests, and listen to the Lord Jesus. Let us also take time. Let us remember John 6: 35 which tells us Hefeeds our hearts with spiritual food. HE IS THE BREAD THAT SATISFIES.
original_verse_text: Give us this day our daily bread.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that it is Your spiritual nourishment that truly satisfies our souls. Help us to be like Mary, who chose the better part by sitting at Your feet and listening to Your words. May we not be consumed by the cares of this world, but instead seek the bread of life that You freely offer. Fill us with Your presence, Lord, that we may be sustained by the riches of Your grace. Amen.
reflection: When Martha and Mary invited Jesus to their house, it was spiritual food that Mary chose when she sat at the feet of Jesus (Luke 10:39). Martha, on the other hand, was concerned about physical food. Mary was taking time to be near their guest and listen to the Lord Jesus. Let us also take time. Let us remember John 6:35, which tells us He feeds our hearts with spiritual food. HE IS THE BREAD THAT SATISFIES.
subject: The Bread That Satisfies
verse_text: Give us this day our daily bread.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 19:How sweet are Your words . Sweeter than honey
tomy mouth. (Ps. 119:103) READ.. PS 119:97-104THOUGHT FOR TODAY:
God spoke through various writers to pen life changing psalms for our
benefit.. The teachings of Jesus shape our character tobecome more
like Him. The writings of Paul shape our minds andlives to holy
living. As the Holy Spirit brings these scriptures to our minds, they
become powerful agents for change in our lives. READING GOD'S WORD
CHALLENGES US TO BE BETTER._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God spoke through various writers to pen life changing psalms for our benefit. The teachings of Jesus shape our character tobecome more like Him. The writings of Paul shape our minds andlives to holy living. As the Holy Spirit brings these scriptures to our minds, they become powerful agents for change in our lives. READING GOD'S WORD CHALLENGES US TO BE BETTER.
original_verse_text: How sweet are Your words. Sweeter than honey tomy mouth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious words You have provided in Your Holy Scriptures. May the truths of Psalm 119 take root in our hearts, that we would delight in Your law and find it sweeter than honey to our mouths. Guide us by Your Spirit to meditate on Your precepts and discern the way of righteousness. Transform us through the power of Your living and active Word, that we may walk in obedience to Your commands. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God spoke through various writers to pen life-changing psalms for our benefit. The teachings of Jesus shape our character to become more like Him. The writings of Paul shape our minds and lives to holy living. As the Holy Spirit brings these scriptures to our minds, they become powerful agents for change in our lives. Reading God's Word challenges us to be better.
subject: The Bible Challenges
verse_text: How sweet are Your words. Sweeter than honey tomy mouth.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 20My dear bothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow
to speak, andslow to get angry. (Jm. 1:19) READ: Pro. 10:19 and
Pro:15:1THOUGHT FOR TODAY:When we talk to much and listen to little we
communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important
then theirs. Jameswisely advices us to reverse this process. He says
we should put amental stop watch on our conversations and keep track
of how much we talk and how much we listen. NOW WHEN PEOPLE TALK WITH
US, DOTHEY FEEL THAT THEIR VIEW POINTS AND IDEAS HAVE VALUE?_ PASTOR
AL_
original_reflection_text: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. Jameswisely advice's us to reverse this process. He says we should put a mental stop watch on our conversations and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen. NOW WHEN PEOPLE TALK WITH US, DOTHEY FEEL THAT THEIR VIEW POINTS AND IDEAS HAVE VALUE?
original_verse_text: My dear bothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our tendency is to speak more and listen less. Forgive us for the times when we have been quick to voice our own opinions, failing to truly hear the perspectives of others. Help us, Lord, to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your servant James has instructed. May we seek to understand rather than to be understood, valuing the thoughts and ideas of those around us. Grant us wisdom and discernment, that we may communicate in a way that reflects Your love and brings glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. Jameswisely advice's us to reverse this process. He says we should put a mental stop watch on our conversations and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen. NOW WHEN PEOPLE TALK WITH US, DOTHEY FEEL THAT THEIR VIEW POINTS AND IDEAS HAVE VALUE?
subject: Importance of Mental Stopwatch
verse_text: My dear bothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 21:_There will be no more death or mourning or
crying__or pain._ (Rev. 21:4) READ Rev. 1-7THOUGHT FOR TODAY:In Rev.
21, John received a vision of a different city--the New Jerusalem. If
you will notice he said less aboutit's design and more about the
character of those who werethere. THINK OF IT: no more death! Nor will
there be any more "Crying or pain." All these things will be replaced
bythe wonderful presence of the God of the universe.REMEMBER THIS WILL
BE THE HOME JESUS IS PREPARING FOR ALL WHO TURN TO HIM FOR
FORGIVENESS. _PASTOR AL_
original_verse_text: There will be no more death or mourning or cryingor pain.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the glorious vision You have revealed to us in Your Word. We look forward to the day when You will wipe away every tear from our eyes, and there will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things will have passed away. Lord, we long for the day when we will see Your Son, Jesus Christ, returning in the clouds, and every eye will see Him. Until that day, fill us with Your hope and comfort, and strengthen us to endure all things for Your name's sake. Amen.
reflection: In Revelation 21, John received a vision of a different city—the New Jerusalem. If you will notice, he said less about its design and more about the character of those who were there. THINK OF IT: no more death! Nor will there be any more “crying or pain.” All these things will be replaced by the wonderful presence of the God of the universe.
subject: God's Dwelling Place
verse_text: There will be no more death or mourning or cryingor pain.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 22:_One thing I do: forgetting what is behind and
straining toward __what is ahead._ (Phil. 3:13) READ Phil.
3:12-16THOUGHT FOR TODAY:None of us are what we should be, but we can,
like the apostle, pray and press on toward that goal. Like Paul we
will always say, "I have not yet arrived." nevertheless, despite
weakness, failure, and weariness, we must press on (vs. 12). But
everything depends on God. without Him we can do nothing. REMEMBER,
GOD IS WITH YOU, CALLING YOU ONWARD, SO KEEPPADDLING. _ PASTOR AL._
original_reflection_text: None of us are what we should be, but we can, like the apostle, pray and press on toward that goal. Like Paul we will always say, "I have not yet arrived. " nevertheless, despite weakness, failure, and weariness, we must press on (vs. 12). But everything depends on God. without Him we can do nothing. REMEMBER, GOD IS WITH YOU, CALLING YOU ONWARD, SO KEEPPADDLING.
original_verse_text: One thing I do: forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that we are not yet what we should be, but we are grateful that You call us onward, pressing us to grow in Christ-likeness. Though we may stumble and feel weary, help us to keep our eyes fixed on the goal, relying on Your strength to carry us forward. May we never be satisfied with where we are, but continually strive to know You more and to become more like Your Son. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: None of us are what we should be, but we can, like the apostle, pray and press on toward that goal. Like Paul we will always say, “I have not yet arrived.” Nevertheless, despite weakness, failure, and weariness, we must press on (vs. 12). But everything depends on God. Without Him we can do nothing. Remember, God is with you, calling you onward, so keep paddling.
subject: God Provides
verse_text: One thing I do: forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 23:_Why have I found favor in You eyes?_ (Ruth 2:10)
READ Ruth 2:1-11THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Like Ruth we are foreigners far from
God. We may wonder why Godwould choose to love us when we are so
undeserving . The answer is not in us, but in Him. God showed His
great love for us when He sentHis Son to die for us while we were
still sinners. (Ro. 5:8) Yes Christhas become our redeemer. When we
come to Him in salvation, we areunder His protective wings.
GRATEFULNESS IS THE HEART'S RESPONSE IN GOD'S UNDESERVED LOVE._ PASTOR
AL_
original_reflection_text: Like Ruth we are foreigners far from God. We may wonder why Godwould choose to love us when we are so undeserving. The answer is not in us, but in Him. God showed His great love for us when He sentHis Son to die for us while we were still sinners. (Romans 5: 8) Yes Christhas become our redeemer. When we come to Him in salvation, we areunder His protective wings. GRATEFULNESS IS THE HEART'S RESPONSE IN GOD'S UNDESERVED LOVE.
original_verse_text: Why have I found favor in You eyes?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as foreigners, undeserving of Your great love and mercy. Yet, You have chosen to redeem us through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Like Ruth, we stand in awe of Your gracious kindness, for it is not our own worthiness that draws us to You, but the unfathomable depths of Your compassion. Fill our hearts with gratitude for the redemption we have found in Christ, our Redeemer, who has welcomed us under the shelter of His protective wings. Amen.
reflection: Like Ruth, we are foreigners far from God. We may wonder why God would choose to love us when we are so undeserving. The answer is not in us, but in Him. God showed His great love for us when He sent His Son to die for us while we were still sinners. (Romans 5:8) Yes, Christ has become our redeemer. When we come to Him in salvation, we are under His protective wings. GRATEFULNESS IS THE HEART'S RESPONSE IN GOD'S UNDESERVED LOVE.
subject: Gratefulness
verse_text: Why have I found favor in You eyes?

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 24:

Jesus said to His disciples _"Let us go over to_

_the other side." _(Mk 4:35) READ Mk 4:35-5:1

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

While crossing this body of water they run into

rough weather to the point of swamping the boat.

Why was this happening? Jesus was with them but He was asleep at the
stern of the boat. They learned that day that IT IS NOT TRUE that when
we do as the Lord says, there will be no storms in our lives. In the
storms of our life, we can be confident that all is not lost.

OUR PILOT CAN HANDLE THE STORM. HE WILL GET US HOME.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: While crossing this body of water they run into rough weather to the point of swamping the boat. Why was this happening? Jesus was with them but He was asleep at the stern of the boat. They learned that day that IT IS NOT TRUE that when we do as the Lord says, there will be no storms in our lives. In the storms of our life, we can be confident that all is not lost. OUR PILOT CAN HANDLE THE STORM. HE WILL GET US HOME.
original_verse_text: Jesus said to His disciples "Let us go over to the other side. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of the storms that rage around us. Though the waves may threaten to overwhelm us, we know that You, our Pilot, are ever-present and in control. Help us to remember that even when it seems You are asleep, You are always watchful over us, guiding us safely home. Give us the faith to trust in Your sovereign power, even when the winds and the waves seem to overwhelm. We thank You for Your unwavering care and protection. Amen.
reflection: While crossing this body of water, they ran into rough weather to the point of swamping the boat. Why was this happening? Jesus was with them, but He was asleep at the stern of the boat. They learned that day that it is not true that when we do as the Lord says, there will be no storms in our lives. In the storms of our life, we can be confident that all is not lost. Our Pilot can handle the storm. He will get us home.
subject: No Worries
verse_text: Jesus said to His disciples “Let us go over to the other side. ”

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 25:Jesus said,_ "I am the resurrection and the life.
Those who believe in Me, even though the die__they will live again."_
Jn. 11:25 READ Jn. 11:14-27THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Jesus has power over life
and death, as well aspower to for give sins. This is because He isthe
creator of life (see Jn. 14:6). He who islife can surely restore life.
Whoever believesin Christ has a spiritual life that death
cannotconquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and
how wonderful His offer to us is,how can we not commit our life to
Him. Tothose of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and
certainty we have. "I WILL LIVEAGAIN AND YOU WILL TOO. (JN. 14:19)_
PASTOR AL___
original_reflection_text: Jesus has power over life and death, as well aspower to for give sins. This is because He isthe creator of life (see John 14: 6). He who islife can surely restore life. Whoever believesin Christ has a spiritual life that death cannotconquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us is, how can we not commit our life to Him. Tothose of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have. I WILL LIVEAGAIN AND YOU WILL TOO. (JN. 14: 19)
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in Me, even though the diethey will live again."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the power and life that Jesus Christ offers to all who believe in Him. Thank You for the assurance that death cannot conquer those who have faith in the One who is the Resurrection and the Life. Lord, may we cling to the promise that in You, we will live again, even when our earthly bodies fail. We commit our lives to You, the Giver of eternal life. Amen.
reflection: Jesus has power over life and death, as well aspower to for give sins. This is because He isthe creator of life (see John 14: 6). He who islife can surely restore life. Whoever believesin Christ has a spiritual life that death cannotconquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us is, how can we not commit our life to Him. Tothose of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have. I WILL LIVEAGAIN AND YOU WILL TOO. (JN. 14: 19)
subject: Death Has Been Defeated
verse_text: Jesus said, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in Me, even though the diethey will live again.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 26:Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted,He is
able to help those who are being tempted. (Heb. 2:18)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:"Because Jesus Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able
to help those who are being tempted." (VS. 18)The Lord could have
avoided the cross. Instead, He obeyed His Father. Through His death,
He broke the power of Satanand freed us from our fear of death, (vss.
14-15) IN EVERY TEMPTATION, JESUS WALKS BESIDE US TO GIVE US COURAGE,
STRENGTH, AND HOPE ALONG THE WAY._ _ _PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: "Because Jesus Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted. " (VS. 18)The Lord could have avoided the cross. Instead, He obeyed His Father. Through His death, He broke the power of Satanand freed us from our fear of death, (vss. 14-15) IN EVERY TEMPTATION, JESUS WALKS BESIDE US TO GIVE US COURAGE, STRENGTH, AND HOPE ALONG THE WAY.
original_subject: REMEMBER hE HAS WALKED IN OUR SHOES
original_verse_text: Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for sending Your Son, Jesus, to walk alongside us in our times of temptation and struggle. Though He faced the same trials we do, He remained without sin, and now He intercedes on our behalf, offering us grace and mercy in our time of need. Lord, grant us the courage to follow in His footsteps, trusting in Your strength to overcome the power of sin and the fear of death. May we find refuge in Your presence, drawing near to Your throne with confidence, that we may receive the help we so desperately need. Amen.
reflection: “Because Jesus Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.” (Vs. 18) The Lord could have avoided the cross. Instead, He obeyed His Father. Through His death, He broke the power of Satan and freed us from our fear of death. (Vss. 14-15) In every temptation, Jesus walks beside us to give us courage, strength, and hope along the way.
subject: Remember He Has Walked in Our Shoes
verse_text: Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 27:_Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you._
(Jn. 14:27) READ:(Jn. 14:16-27)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Even though we are
God's children we will still experience hardship, we toohave His
Spirit living within and flowing out of us. God's peace canbe His
witness to everyone we meet--whether at a local market place,at work,
or in a gym. WHEN WE KEEP OUR MIND ON GOD, HIS SPIRIT KEEPS OUR MIND
AT PEACE._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Even though we are God's children we will still experience hardship, we toohave His Spirit living within and flowing out of us. God's peace canbe His witness to everyone we meet--whether at a local market place, at work, or in a gym. WHEN WE KEEP OUR MIND ON GOD, HIS SPIRIT KEEPS OUR MIND AT PEACE.
original_verse_text: Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that even in the midst of life's challenges, You promise us Your peace that surpasses all understanding. Help us to keep our minds steadfast on You, that Your Spirit may dwell within us and flow out to those around us. May Your peace be a witness to the world of Your abiding presence and love. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Even though we are God's children, we will still experience hardship. We too have His Spirit living within and flowing out of us. God's peace can be His witness to everyone we meet—whether at a local marketplace, at work, or in a gym. When we keep our mind on God, His Spirit keeps our mind at peace.
subject: Flowing Peace
verse_text: Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 28:Jesus said,_ "My God, My God, why have you
forsaken__Me._ (Mt. 27:46) READ Mt. 2639=42)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:Sometimes it seems as though God isn't listening tous. The
reason could be that when we pray, we mayNOT see how God is working or
understand how He will bring any good through it all. So we have to
trustHim. We have to relinquish our rights and let God dowhat is best.
We must leave the unknown to the allknowing One. WHEN WE BEND OUR
KNEES TO PRAY, GOD BENDS HIS EAR TO HEAR._ PASTOR AL_ ____
original_reflection_text: Sometimes it seems as though God isn't listening to us. The reason could be that when we pray, we may NOT see how God is working or understand how He will bring any good through it all. So we have to trust Him. We have to relinquish our rights and let God dowhat is best. We must leave the unknown to the all knowing One. WHEN WE BEND OUR KNEES TO PRAY, GOD BENDS HIS EAR TO HEAR.
original_subject: DON'T DOUBT GOD'S ABILITY TO LISTEN
original_verse_text: Jesus said, "My God, My God, why have you forsakenMe.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of struggle and uncertainty, when it seems as though You have forsaken us. Help us to trust in Your perfect plan, even when we cannot see the way forward. Grant us the strength to relinquish our rights and submit to Your will, for You are the all-knowing God who works all things together for our good. May we cling to the truth that when we bend our knees to pray, You bend Your ear to hear. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Sometimes it seems as though God isn't listening to us. The reason could be that when we pray, we may not see how God is working or understand how He will bring any good through it all. So we have to trust Him. We have to relinquish our rights and let God do what is best. We must leave the unknown to the all-knowing One. When we bend our knees to pray, God bends His ear to hear.
subject: Don't Doubt God's Ability to Listen
verse_text: Jesus said, “My God, My God, why have you forsakenMe.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 29:_Live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him__in
every way._ (Colossians 1:10) READ (Colossians 1:9-14)THOUGHT FOR TODAY: As
believers in our Lord Jesus Christ we often feel that God owes us such
things as, good health, a comfortable life, and material blessings. Of
course,God does not owe us anything. Yet He gives useverything Each
day whether good or bad, is onemore gift from our God. Our grateful
response should be to live for Him. OUR LIFE IS A GIFT FROMGOD AND
SHOULD BE LIVED FOR HIM._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: As believers in our Lord Jesus Christ we often feel that God owes us such things as, good health, a comfortable life, and material blessings. Of course, God does not owe us anything. Yet He gives useverything Each day whether good or bad, is onemore gift from our God. Our grateful response should be to live for Him. OUR LIFE IS A GIFT FROMGOD AND SHOULD BE LIVED FOR HIM.
original_verse_text: Live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him in every way.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing that every good and perfect gift comes from You. Help us to live in a manner worthy of Your calling, bearing fruit in every good work and growing in the knowledge of You. May our lives be a reflection of Your love and grace, not seeking our own comfort or blessings, but desiring to honor and serve You in all things. We surrender ourselves to Your will, trusting that Your plans for us are good. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: As believers in our Lord Jesus Christ, we often feel that God owes us such things as good health, a comfortable life, and material blessings. Of course, God does not owe us anything. Yet He gives us everything. Each day, whether good or bad, is one more gift from our God. Our grateful response should be to live for Him. Our life is a gift from God and should be lived for Him.
subject: What God Owes Us
verse_text: Live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him in every way.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 30:_A broken and contrite heart You, God, will _n_ot__
despise. _ (Ps. 51:17) READ (Ps. 51:7-17)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:when we are
truly broken over our sins, God lovingly puts us back together. "If we
confess our sins, He isfaithful and just and will forgive us our sins
and purifyus from all unrighteousness." (I Jn.. 1:9) Humility isthe
right response to God's holinesS. AND PRAISE IS OUR HEARTS RESPONSE TO
HIS FORGIVENESS.
_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we are truly broken over our sins, God lovingly puts us back together. "If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness. " (I John 1: 9) Humility is the right response to God's holiness. AND PRAISE IS OUR HEARTS RESPONSE TO HIS FORGIVENESS.
original_verse_text: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble and contrite hearts, acknowledging our sins and shortcomings. Cleanse us, Lord, with the hyssop of Your grace, and wash us until we are whiter than snow. Create in us a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within us. May our sacrifice be a broken and contrite heart, which You, in Your great mercy, will not despise. We give You all praise and glory, for You alone are worthy. Amen.
reflection: When we are truly broken over our sins, God lovingly puts us back together. “If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.” (1 John 1:9) Humility is the right response to God's holiness, and praise is our heart's response to His forgiveness.
subject: Praise from Pure Hearts
verse_text: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 31:_With man this is impossible, but not with God; all
things__are possible with God._ (Mk. 10:27) READ Mk. 10:17-27THOUGHT
FOR TODAY:What was the Teacher thinking? His own disciples werealarmed
and asked, "who then can be saved?" Jesusreplied, "_With man this is
impossible, but not with God; __all things are possible with God."
(vs. 27)_ It takes courageand faith._ "If you declare with your mouth,
Jesus is Lord, and__believe in your hear that God raised Him from the
dead,__your will be saved._ (Ro. 10:9) BELIEVE IN THE LORD JESUS,AND
YOU WILL BE SAVED. _ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: What was the Teacher thinking? His own disciples were alarmed and asked, "who then can be saved?" Jesus replied, "With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God. " (vs. 27) It takes courageand faith. "If you declare with your mouth, Jesus is Lord, and believe in your hear that God raised Him from the dead, your will be saved. (Romans 10: 9) BELIEVE IN THE LORD JESUS, AND YOU WILL BE SAVED.
original_verse_text: With man this is impossible, but not with God; all thingsare possible with God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that salvation is not possible through our own strength or merit, but only through Your divine power and grace. Lord, we confess that the way of salvation may seem impossible to us, but we know that all things are possible with You. Help us to have the courage and faith to declare with our mouths that Jesus is Lord and to believe in our hearts that You have raised Him from the dead. May we find our salvation in You alone, for You are the source of all hope and redemption. Amen.
reflection: What was the teacher thinking? His own disciples were alarmed and asked, “Who then can be saved?” Jesus replied, “With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.” (vs. 27) It takes courage and faith. “If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.” (Romans 10:9) Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved.
subject: Knowing and Doing
verse_text: With man this is impossible, but not with God; all thingsare possible with God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JUNE 1:_The eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth_ _to
strengthen __those whose hearts are fully_ _committed to Him._ ((2
Chron. 16:9) READ (2 Chron. 16:7-14)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:WHY, do our
hearts need strengthening? Because doing the right thing may require
courage and perseverance. Think of Job, hiscrime, he [was] blameless
and upright. (Job 18) Joseph, [falsely] accused of attempted rape.was
placed in prison for years. (Gen. 39:19ff) Jerimiah, was beaten and
put in prison. FOR WHAT? For telling the truth to rebellious people.
(26:15) Life is not simple, and God's ways are not our ways. Making
the right decision may come at a cost. BUT IN GOD'S ETERNAL PLAN, HIS
BLESSINGS ARRIVE IN DUE TIME. AND GOD HELPS THOSE WHO DEPEND ON HIM.
original_reflection_text: WHY, do our hearts need strengthening? Because doing the right thing may require courage and perseverance. Think of Job, hiscrime, he [was] blameless and upright. (Job 18) Joseph, [falsely] accused of attempted rape. was placed in prison for years. (Genesis 39: 19ff) Jeremiah, was beaten and put in prison. FOR WHAT? For telling the truth to rebellious people. (26: 15) Life is not simple, and God's ways are not our ways. Making the right decision may come at a cost. BUT IN GOD'S ETERNAL PLAN, HIS BLESSINGS ARRIVE IN DUE TIME. AND GOD HELPS THOSE WHO DEPEND ON HIM.
original_verse_text: The eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your strength and guidance. As we face the challenges of this world, may our eyes be fixed on You, the One who sees all and knows all. Help us to have the courage and perseverance to do what is right, even when it comes at a cost. Remind us that Your ways are not our ways, and that in Your eternal plan, Your blessings will arrive in due time. Lord, we depend on You, for You are the source of our strength. Amen.
reflection: WHY, do our hearts need strengthening? Because doing the right thing may require courage and perseverance. Think of Job, hiscrime, he [was] blameless and upright. (Job 18) Joseph, [falsely] accused of attempted rape. was placed in prison for years. (Genesis 39: 19ff) Jeremiah, was beaten and put in prison. FOR WHAT? For telling the truth to rebellious people. (26: 15) Life is not simple, and God's ways are not our ways. Making the right decision may come at a cost. BUT IN GOD'S ETERNAL PLAN, HIS BLESSINGS ARRIVE IN DUE TIME. AND GOD HELPS THOSE WHO DEPEND ON HIM.
subject: Not a Simple Story
verse_text: The eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to Him.
